name: Cimarron Inn Klamath Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A nice quiet hotel. Very inexpensive. The staff was helpful in giving us directions to the hotel when mapquest sent us downtown (miserably off course). The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. There is a Denny's and an Elmers very close by.
reviews.title: Very nice, quiet place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very nice, and very reasonably priced . The digital door lock required an extra hard push on the card to make it work. The expanded breakfast was great, with DIY waffles, and other goodies.
reviews.title: Would Stay There Again

reviews.text: the pool was being serviced/renovated so we could not use it. We were in the family suite which was perfect for us. My son had his own bedroom so my daughter and I could have our own space. What a value!! Clean, comfortable and a nice breakfast with the waffle maker. The breakfast room could have been a tad cleaner, tables not wiped off, but I am a picky person. Would stay again. The eating establishment next door is kind of odd but the food was decent.
reviews.title: great price for a clean, comfortable room
Great and Unexpected Find
reviews.text: We stopped by hear on the way back from our vacation. It is a surprising gem of a place that is totally unexpected in an otherwise boring town.
The hotel rooms are upgraded and everything is well maintained
reviews.title: I love to find good value and this place is it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Hotel for the price, plus we were traveling with two pets. Everyone was very nice and helpful, the breakfast was nice.
reviews.title: Nice Stay for the night while traveling through Oregon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We looked at this hotel and it's ratings from previous ratings and made the decision to stay. We were very pleased with the service and the cleanliness. We even stayed in the wing that was in the process of being remodeled and found our stay to be very nice. The price was great and the room was better. Would defiantly stay here again.
reviews.title: A very welcome surprise!

reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel at 5:30pm expecting to check into the rooms we had reserved two weeks in advance. We were told that they were not ready. After checking with housekeeping we were told it would be 45 minutes or more. We were hungry so we went to the Elmer's restaurant near by. We returned at 6:30 and checked into our rooms. We were given no consideration for the inconvenience and no explanation. At check out the next morning I asked the front desk person if there might be a shortage of housekeepers, no, she replied.I then asked her if it was normal to not have rooms ready at 5:30. She said that it was, and had been that way all summer. Again, no apology's and no explanation. She pretty much just let me know that that's the way it is. So, in conclusion I would have to say that if you want to stay in a nice older property and are not wanting to check in before dinner, this might be your place. However, this area of town has many newer and nicer choices. The attitude more than the inconvenience would keep me from returning to the Cimarron. There are several other choices nearby.
reviews.title: Don't get there early

reviews.text: A great place to rest on a long road trip. Loved all the extra pillows. The motel is quiet, nicely decorated, and has great staff. The free continental breakfast was great and the room was inexpensive and comfortable. I noticed that there was an Oxford Suites van out front and the questionaire was by Oxford Suites. Oxford Suites seem to always go the extra mile in offering the most value for your money. The front dest greeted us with fresh cookies, and the room decor was new and stylish. I have paid twice the room rate for rooms not as nice as this one. There are lots of shopping oportunities near the motel, and a Dutch Brothers (great coffee) across the street.
reviews.title: A great night's sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before going to Crater Lake, I researched the available hotels and motels in Klamath Falls, which is about 1 hour south of Crater Lake. The Cimarron Motor Inn was ranked #3 in Klamath Falls at the time I was looking, and the rate of $59 that they had on Expedia was exactly the range I was looking for. I booked it through Expedia, and I must say that it was a truly delightful experience. The property is located on a major thoroughfare through Klamath Falls, and was pretty easy to find. It is surrounded by shopping and restaurants, including Elmer's which offers a 10% discount to people staying at the Cimarron Motor Inn. The desk clerk at check-in was waiting for us, and had all of the proper paperwork in order, and was very efficient and friendly. The room itself was exactly what I expected. The cleanliness was exemplary. Everywhere I looked, everything was fresh and clean. There was a microwave and a refrigerator and an air-conditioning unit that worked very well. The bathroom amenities were nice, and the towels all seemed new. The linens on the bed and the comforter were clean and very nice. My room was on the 2nd floor. I liked the access to the walking/jogging trail immediately behind the motel, and walked about 1.5 miles along it...very pretty at this time of year.
reviews.title: Thanks Tripadvisor -- this one is a real gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of my best stays ever in a chain motel. Can't be beat for price, comp. breakfast, clean room. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LIke many hotels the advertising pictures look better than the product. This is an average place with nothing really great and nothing awful [except the towels].
reviews.title: Fairly Average Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Freshly painted rooms
reviews.title: Great Stay ! Great Price !

reviews.text: Reasonably equipped
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!

reviews.text: Fairly central location in Klamath Falls
reviews.title: Visiting Klamath Falls? Choose the Cimarron

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We found this hotel late at night while passing through on our way to California, and it was a a great find! It was very reasonably priced, and you get a comfortable, clean room and friendly service. They are pet friendly, with just a modest $10 surcharge, which still makes the room more affordable than the big name chains. The desk clerk was very friendly. We didn't try the breakfast, but your room key gets you 10% off at Elmer's next door, which had a delicious breakfast. If we are in the area again, we would definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Clean, friendly and convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This property is a trifecta-extremely reasonable rate, great service, and clean, comfortable, well-appointed room.
reviews.title: High Quality + Low Cost=Highly Recommended Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at midnight and not only was the young woman at the front desk friendly and helpful at such a late hour, but she offered us late checkout without us having to ask! How often does that happen at ANY hotel these days??? Impressive.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was clean and well-appointed with tasteful, modern furnishings and window treatments. It also had a comfortable love seat with a coffee table, which was a really nice, useful touch. The bed was comfortable and boasted about 50 pillows. The bed and decor were as nice or nicer than what you'd find at any Red Lion or similar.
reviews.title: Nice Place to Stay

reviews.text: The free continental breakfast included make-your-own waffles and homemade biscuits and gravy. It was more than cold cereal and coffee, which was great.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, great rate

description: Exceptional has never been so affordable! Located in the heart of Klamath Falls, Cimarron Inn Klamath Falls is just minutes from historic downtown, Klamath Museum, shopping venues and the award winning Running Y golf course. Complimentary amenities include Breakfast Buffet, High Speed Wi-Fi, Premium Bedding and Seasonal Heated Outdoor Pool.
